History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient has faced challenges with emotional control leading to incarceration. They express regret over past decisions and relationships that have negatively impacted their life.
Medical and Psychiatric History: The patient has been diagnosed with PTSD approximately two and a half to three years ago and has sought help to understand themselves better.
Psychosocial History: The patient is originally from South LA and appreciates the weather, opportunities, and community, but dislikes issues like racism and police brutality. Their relationship with family has improved over time, and they admire their mother for her resilience.
Mental Health Observations: The patient describes themselves as shy in uncomfortable situations but outgoing when at ease. They are working on controlling their temper and have made progress over the years.
Physiological Observations: The patient reports ongoing sleep issues and has used over-the-counter sleep medications, which have negative side effects.
Current Functional Status: The patient is not currently working in their field of study (psychology) and aspires to own a record label. They express feeling overwhelmed by responsibilities after recently being released from prison.
Diagnostic Impressions: The patient has PTSD and is actively seeking therapy to address their mental health.
Progress Evaluation: The patient has noticed improvements in decision-making and emotional maturity since starting therapy, learning to assess situations before reacting.
Medications: The patient has used over-the-counter sleep medications but has stopped due to undesirable side effects.
Therapeutic Interventions: The patient is currently attending therapy and finds it beneficial for personal growth and emotional regulation.
Next Steps: The patient will continue therapy and work on implementing better coping strategies for emotional situations.
